metadata.title: Project Setup & Initial Web App Structure

story.iWant: to set up the project repository and initial web application structure,
story.soThat: I can begin implementing core features.
story.tasks: - [ ] **Task 1: Initialize Git Repository (AC: 1)** - [ ] Subtask 1.1: Run `git init` in the project root. - [ ] Subtask 1.2: Create a `.gitignore` file based on standard Next.js and Python projects. - [ ] Subtask 1.3: Make initial commit with project structure. - [ ] **Task 2: Scaffold Next.js Frontend Application (AC: 2)** - [ ] Subtask 2.1: Execute `npx create-next-app@latest frontend --typescript --eslint --app` (or similar command given project context). - [ ] Subtask 2.2: Verify Next.js App Router structure is in place (`frontend/src/app/`). - [ ] Subtask 2.3: Integrate Chakra UI into the Next.js project. - [ ] **Task 3: Scaffold FastAPI Backend Application (AC: 2)** - [ ] Subtask 3.1: Create `backend/` directory with basic FastAPI application structure (`backend/app/main.py`). - [ ] Subtask 3.2: Configure `requirements.txt` for FastAPI and necessary dependencies. - [ ] **Task 4: Implement Basic Frontend Display (AC: 3)** - [ ] Subtask 4.1: Modify `frontend/src/app/page.tsx` to display a simple "Hello QuizZum!" message. - [ ] **Task 5: Verify Application Startup (AC: 3)** - [ ] Subtask 5.1: Run `npm run dev` in `frontend/`. - [ ] Subtask 5.2: Access `localhost:3000` (or similar) in browser and confirm basic page display. - [ ] **Task 6: Setup Local Development Environment (AC: 1, 2, 3)** - [ ] Subtask 6.1: Create `docker-compose.yml` for local development setup as per architectural guidelines (including placeholder services for PostgreSQL, Redis for future epics). - [ ] Subtask 6.2: Ensure `docker-compose.yml` allows the frontend and backend to run concurrently for development. - [ ] **Task 7: Write Basic Unit/Integration Tests (AC: 1, 2, 3)** - [ ] Subtask 7.1: Add a simple test to verify `.git` folder exists after initialization. - [ ] Subtask 7.2: Add a simple test to verify `package.json` contains Next.js and React dependencies. - [ ] Subtask 7.3: Add a simple test to confirm a basic empty web page is displayed when running the application.

story-context.acceptanceCriteria: 1. Given a new project, when I initialize the project, then a git repository is created and configured. 2. doc.title: QuizZum - Product Requirements Document
doc.snippet: QuizZum is an AI-powered learning tool designed to alleviate student overwhelm and cognitive overload when processing complex academic material. It achieves this by providing a frictionless platform to transform lecture notes (text or PDF) into structured, digestible multi-level summaries (easy, medium, hard) and adaptive quizzes that target weak spots.

doc.title: QuizZum - Product Requirements Document
doc.snippet: This project is classified as a Web Application (web_app) due to its web-first approach and browser-based accessibility. It operates within the EdTech domain, aligning with educational content and student learning. The overall complexity is assessed as Medium, reflecting the AI integration and adaptive features.

doc.title: QuizZum - Product Requirements Document
doc.snippet: Epic 1: Foundation & Core Content Input. Goal: Establish the basic application infrastructure and allow users to provide content for processing.

doc.title: QuizZum - Product Requirements Document
doc.snippet: Platform Support: Single Page Application (SPA) for a seamless, dynamic user experience. Browser Matrix: Latest stable versions of Google Chrome, Microsoft Edge, Mozilla Firefox, Brave, and Opera on desktop. Responsive Design: The application should be fully responsive and function well across various screen sizes (desktop, tablet, mobile).

doc.title: QuizZum - Product Requirements Document
doc.snippet: FR-001: (MVP) Users can input text notes into the application. FR-002: (MVP) Users can upload PDF documents containing notes. FR-018: (MVP) The application runs as a Single Page Application (SPA). FR-019: (MVP) The application functions on the latest stable versions of Google Chrome, Microsoft Edge, Mozilla Firefox, Brave, and Opera on desktop. FR-020: (MVP) The application is fully responsive across various screen sizes (desktop, tablet, mobile).

doc.title: QuizZum - Product Requirements Document
doc.snippet: The backend will expose a RESTful API. The following endpoints are envisioned for the MVP: POST /api/upload/text, POST /api/upload/pdf, POST /api/summarize, POST /api/quiz.

doc.title: Architecture
doc.snippet: My initial analysis confirms QuizZum's objective: an AI-powered learning tool mitigating student overwhelm via multi-level summaries and adaptive quizzes from text/PDF inputs. It is a web-based Single Page Application (SPA) requiring robust performance, scalability, and adherence to WCAG 2.1 Level AA accessibility standards.

doc.title: Architecture
doc.snippet: Our project will be initialized using Next.js, leveraging its App Router for a modern, scalable React application. This framework provides a strong, production-ready foundation that will support QuizZum's complex AI integrations and future growth.

doc.title: Architecture
doc.snippet: API Pattern & Backend Tech: REST API with FastAPI (Python). Deployment Target: Local Development Environment.

doc.title: Architecture
doc.snippet: Our project will follow a split-repository structure for now, with dedicated directories for the frontend and backend. This provides a clear separation of concerns for development.

doc.title: Architecture
doc.snippet: Epic 1: Foundation & Core Content Input. Frontend: frontend/src/app/input-screen/*. Backend: backend/app/api/upload/*. Shared: docker-compose.yml.

doc.title: Architecture
doc.snippet: Frontend: React, Next.js (App Router), JavaScript, Chakra UI. Backend: FastAPI, Python, Celery with Redis. Database: PostgreSQL.

doc.title: Architecture
doc.snippet: Prerequisites: Node.js, Python, Docker, Git. Setup Commands: `git clone`, `npm install`, `npm run dev`, `python -m venv venv`, `pip install -r requirements.txt`, `uvicorn main:app --reload`, `docker run --name quizum-postgres`, `docker run --name quizum-redis`, `celery -A main.celery_app worker`.

doc.title: QuizZum UX Design Specification
doc.snippet: QuizZum is an AI-powered learning tool designed to alleviate student overwhelm and cognitive overload when processing complex academic material. Its core differentiators include a radical focus on simplicity, an active and "playable" learning experience, and hierarchical, adaptive content.

doc.title: QuizZum UX Design Specification
doc.snippet: We've definitively chosen Chakra UI as our primary design system. It offers a highly modular and accessible component library. Its built-in WAI-ARIA compliance and flexible styling capabilities ensure we can efficiently develop a modern React-based application that is both user-friendly and aesthetically aligned.

doc.title: QuizZum UX Design Specification
doc.snippet: The defining experience of QuizZum is "The app that helps you learn once and for all." This speaks to a transformative learning journey where users achieve profound mastery, overcome content comprehension struggles, and experience lasting knowledge retention.

doc.title: QuizZum UX Design Specification
doc.snippet: Our chosen design direction for the input screen is "3. Feature-forward (Guided)". This approach emphasizes clarity, support, and a proactive onboarding experience, perfectly aligning with QuizZum's goal of alleviating student overwhelm.

doc.title: QuizZum UX Design Specification
doc.snippet: Flow Steps: Input Content (Input Screen), View Summaries (Summary Results Screen). User sees: A clean, uncluttered input screen featuring a prominent text input area, "Upload PDF" button, and "Generate Summaries" button.

doc.title: QuizZum UX Design Specification
doc.snippet: Our component strategy leverages the robust foundation of Chakra UI while focusing custom development efforts on key areas that embody QuizZum's unique adaptive learning experience and playful personality. Custom components: Adaptive Summary Display, Interactive Quiz Question & Answer, Dynamic Scorecard & Adaptive Feedback.

doc.title: QuizZum UX Design Specification
doc.snippet: QuizZum will be built with a thoughtful, adaptive responsive strategy to ensure a visually great and fully functional experience across all devices. Mobile-First, Tablet Adaptation (dynamic layout), Desktop & Large Screens (side-by-side). Target WCAG 2.1 Level AA compliance.

doc.snippet: Story 1.1: (MVP) Project Setup & Initial Web App Structure. User Story: As a developer, I want to set up the project repository and initial web application structure, so that I can begin implementing core features. Acceptance Criteria: 1. Given a new project, when I initialize the project, then a git repository is created and configured. 2. Given a new project, when I set up the basic web application, then a Single Page Application (SPA) structure is in place. 3. Given the initial setup, when I run the application, then a basic empty web page is displayed in the browser. Technical Notes: This story covers repository creation, initial frontend (SPA) scaffolding, and basic server setup for hosting the frontend.
